rows.label: ITM_CLC001_Caption
rows.name:
A gourd-like vegetable encased in a black
rind. The spongy, white insides have no
taste at all, and are mostly used as a
source of various vitamins.

rows.label: ITM_CLC002_Caption
rows.name:
A teardrop-shaped potato found in
Primordial Wilderness. Extremely bitter, it's unsuited
for direct use in food, but is often used
as a source of protein in processed foods.

rows.label: ITM_CLC003_Caption
rows.name:
A heat-emitting lettuce whose flickering
leaves resemble the sun. Oddly prone to
self-combustion, it can only be found on
rainy days.

rows.label: ITM_CLC004_Caption
rows.name:
Its fine strands make a furball shape,
while its colorful hue promises a taste
far more exotic than the humble cabbage
it resembles.

rows.label: ITM_CLC005_Caption
rows.name:
A carrot that splits into eight roots. Seven
of these are ultra sweet, while the
remaining one takes on a bitterness that
makes even the most stoic eyes water.

rows.label: ITM_CLC006_Caption
rows.name:
A tomato that is able to hold impressive
amounts of water. It appears only on
rainy days, when its juicy flesh is enjoyed
by many local indigens.

rows.label: ITM_CLC007_Caption
rows.name:
This fungus from Nightglow Forest releases spores
that send nearby creatures into a daze.
Its subspecies imparts a bliss-like state on
all who consume it.

rows.label: ITM_CLC008_Caption
rows.name:
A sweet, tough eggplant that grows from
trees and absorbs their sap. It also draws
out pathogens from within the tree,
thus increasing the life of its parent.

rows.label: ITM_CLC009_Caption
rows.name:
A plant with seemingly self-aware mouthed
tendrils that extend outwards to hunt
nearby insects. Rich in protein, they are
in turn a source of nourishment for others.

rows.label: ITM_CLC010_Caption
rows.name:
Flora that grows by absorbing plasma
from the surrounding atmosphere. Its deep
taste and numbing effects are coveted
by chefs and foodies everywhere.

rows.label: ITM_CLC011_Caption
rows.name:
A subspecies of the caseras mushroom,
which only appears once every 100 years.
Those who taste it are said to live out
their days in a pure, bliss-like state.

rows.label: ITM_CLC012_Caption
rows.name:
A vegetable that takes like cabbage.
It sports an odd blackish tint that only
intensifies when boiled.

rows.label: ITM_CLC013_Caption
rows.name:
A root with a tapered horn shape that
requires thick gloves for proper handling.
Eating it grants superb recovery
properties, but also horrific breath.

rows.label: ITM_CLC014_Caption
rows.name:
A thick casing houses multiple fist-sized
beans. Eating just one provides a day's
worth of nourishment, making them ideal
for long journeys.

rows.label: ITM_CLC015_Caption
rows.name:
A new gourd that arrived with an alien
race. Despite its bland taste, its ability to
grow in the most sterile of land makes it
an invaluable foodstuff.

rows.label: ITM_CLC016_Caption
rows.name:
A pepper that flashes red, yellow, blue,
and then black in a continuous sequence.
It's a feast for both the eyes and the
stomach.

rows.label: ITM_CLC017_Caption
rows.name:
A magnetically charged grass covered in
iron dust. Its ability to remove excess iron
from the body upon digestion makes it
a widely used herbal remedy.

rows.label: ITM_CLC018_Caption
rows.name:
A crown-shaped broccoli that is said to
bestow the lordship of Mira to those who
eat it. Tests indicate that consumption
does indeed lead to feelings of grandeur.

rows.label: ITM_CLC019_Caption
rows.name:
A radish with interlocking roots that
resemble the DNA double helix.
Its grand appearance is sadly not matched
by its lame, radish-y taste.

rows.label: ITM_CLC020_Caption
rows.name:
Beans that increase the effects of alcohol,
often leading to dangerous results.
Drinkers are advised to find a different
bar snack if at all possible.

rows.label: ITM_CLC021_Caption
rows.name:
The casing of this plant contains seeds
finer than a grain of sand. Shaking it
produces a pleasant rhythmic sound that
is sure to calm moods and relieve stress.

rows.label: ITM_CLC022_Caption
rows.name:
A blue-white crop with an appearance
similar to corn. As the plant grows,
its seeds fill with gas before finally
detaching and drifting away on the wind.

rows.label: ITM_CLC023_Caption
rows.name:
A rare type of celery that arises only from
the crevices of deceased fauna soaked by
incessant rain. Its taste depends entirely
on the type of carcass from which it grew.

rows.label: ITM_CLC024_Caption
rows.name:
Peeling this onion's skin reveals an
inedible middle. The subtly sweet taste of
the outer layers, however, is something
to be savored.

rows.label: ITM_CLC025_Caption
rows.name:
A chili pepper infused with the energy of
lightning, guaranteed to bring even the
strongest to their knees. It's more at home
in the arms industry than a kitchen.

rows.label: ITM_CLC026_Caption
rows.name:
This may look like a tree, but it feels and
tastes like bamboo. The fiercer indigens of
Cauldros often use its outer cap to polish
their fangs and tusks.

rows.label: ITM_CLC027_Caption
rows.name:
A poisonous black root that can kill even
the largest of creatures. If left unchecked,
it eventually ends its own existence as
deadly toxins spread throughout its cells.

rows.label: ITM_CLC028_Caption
rows.name:
Its transparent skin encases a jelly like
granulated fruit. The juice may be sweet,
but it is also extremely sticky and a real
chore to clean. Handle with care!

rows.label: ITM_CLC029_Caption
rows.name:
An orange easily mistaken for a rock. It 
may have a soft and sumptuous taste,
but many find it hard to look past its
rather unappealing appearance.

rows.label: ITM_CLC030_Caption
rows.name:
A fruit that looks like a burdock,
but tastes like a strawberry. It usually
undergoes processing into a strawberry
form in order to please a picky public.

rows.label: ITM_CLC031_Caption
rows.name:
Beneath the black skin lies a seed that
sparkles like a star, but also finds itself
primed to go supernova. Sadly, removing
the seed causes the fruit it to lose its
trademark glow.

rows.label: ITM_CLC032_Caption
rows.name:
Ingestion may cause feelings of euphoria,
with side effects including chest thumping
and shrieks of joy. However, its intense
spice should be taken into consideration.

rows.label: ITM_CLC033_Caption
rows.name:
An ultrasonic lemon whose calls are out
of human hearing range. Miran natives
who pick up on its wails can often be
found desperately seeking out the source.

rows.label: ITM_CLC034_Caption
rows.name:
A palm-sized fruit that grows wild in the
woods of Nightglow Forest. Continued exposure to
the sun's rays will dissolve the skin and 
reveal the flesh within.

rows.label: ITM_CLC035_Caption
rows.name:
Upon ripening, this fruit will dislodge
itself from the tree and fall to the ground,
causing serious injury to any unfortunate
enough to be in the way.

rows.label: ITM_CLC036_Caption
rows.name:
An unusually broad-leaved and sturdy
plant that aggressively propagates itself,
shoving aside other plants and even rocks
as it grows.

rows.label: ITM_CLC037_Caption
rows.name:
A luminescent fruit that grows within the
giant flowers of Nightglow Forest. Adorned with
long, sharp thorns, those that fall prey to
its glow usually meet a painful end.

rows.label: ITM_CLC038_Caption
rows.name:
A fruit with rubberlike elasticity.
Its skin has been used in the clothing 
industry, while its sweet, chewy texture
yields a sensation similar to that of gum.

rows.label: ITM_CLC039_Caption
rows.name:
A sour plum that only grows in dark
caves. Its taste can reduce even the
hardiest of creatures to their knees,
and sends most fleeing in terror.

rows.label: ITM_CLC040_Caption
rows.name:
A dull looking, banana-flavored leaf. 
Although loved by all for its flavor,
its habit of camouflaging itself as just
another leaf makes it a rather rare find.

rows.label: ITM_CLC041_Caption
rows.name:
A rare, light-emitting melon. Worshiped
since the dawn of time as a sacred fruit,
a single bite of its flesh is said to inspire
enlightenment. ...Or at least a smile.

rows.label: ITM_CLC042_Caption
rows.name:
Growing only in the stormiest of climes,
at first this fruit looks no different than a
clump of sand. Once it ripens, however,
it takes on the look of a watermelon.

rows.label: ITM_CLC043_Caption
rows.name:
A fruit so large that only one grows per
tree. Its juice can be mixed with alcohol
to create a palatable, wine-like drink.

rows.label: ITM_CLC044_Caption
rows.name:
A kiwi with an egg-like shell. This hard
casing acts as a protective shield,
guarding the inner contents against
various Miran insects.

rows.label: ITM_CLC045_Caption
rows.name:
A fruit covered in sharp thorns and prized
for its blood-clotting effects. The bleeding
its harvest causes, however, means more
than a few are devoured in the field.

rows.label: ITM_CLC046_Caption
rows.name:
A lack of flesh is made up for by
numerous edible seeds. Although bitter,
they are also quite addictive, causing
eaters to devour them without pause.

rows.label: ITM_CLC047_Caption
rows.name:
A fruit that captures the surrounding cold
air. So cold as to induce frostbite with a
single touch, it can only be eaten after
being brought to room temperature.

rows.label: ITM_CLC048_Caption
rows.name:
A fruit that contains white, snowflake-like
seeds. It has a harsh and bitter flavor,
and is often used as a pick-me-up for
those residing in colder climes.

rows.label: ITM_CLC049_Caption
rows.name:
A grape with patterned, jewellike seeds.
Though for the most part immensely sour,
it is also known to turn sweet on rare
occasionsâ€”bringing joy to all who eat it.

rows.label: ITM_CLC050_Caption
rows.name:
Brimming with energy, this mysterious fruit
is prone to cataclysmic explosion upon
impact. Tread carefully when harvesting.

rows.label: ITM_CLC051_Caption
rows.name:
A fruit with a meaty taste. Heating brings
about strange anomalies in its flavor,
with high temperatures evoking beef,
and low temperatures pork.

rows.label: ITM_CLC052_Caption
rows.name:
A heat-resistant seed, often found in lava,
that forms into fruit-bearing rock upon
cooling. Though sweet and nutritious,
it remains a tough nut to crack.

rows.label: ITM_CLC053_Caption
rows.name:
With a skin as tough as iron, this akebi
is well equipped to surviving its harsh
environment. Having existed for countless
millennia, there is doubtless extremely
vital genetic information dormant within.

rows.label: ITM_CLC054_Caption
rows.name:
A fig with strong purification effects that
thrives even in bad soil. So strong are its 
effects that it has the ability to diminish
vital nutrition if taken without cause.

rows.label: ITM_CLC055_Caption
rows.name:
A black pineapple dotted with eyelike
reticules. Those who touch it are said to
be sent into a fit of nightmares. Only
recommended for the strong of mind.

rows.label: ITM_CLC056_Caption
rows.name:
A grass that immediately regenerates
upon being cut. If chopped, each piece
will grow into yet more grass, making
incineration the only proven method of
disposal.

rows.label: ITM_CLC057_Caption
rows.name:
A white lily that, when bathed in the light
of the moon, emits a faint golden glow.
Drawn towards its bloom, many types of 
insect are often found around its flower.

rows.label: ITM_CLC058_Caption
rows.name:
A flower that blooms only for a single
fleeting moment each day before shying
away come nightfall. Its color is truly
magnificent for those lucky enough to
witness it.

rows.label: ITM_CLC059_Caption
rows.name:
An alluring type of grass that has the
power to entrance more than just felines.
Its potent aroma attracts all manner of
wildlife from miles around.

rows.label: ITM_CLC060_Caption
rows.name:
This dandelion fires its seed at nearby
wildlife, whereupon the seeds feed
parasitically on their host. Accordingly,
the life of the host is rarely long.

rows.label: ITM_CLC061_Caption
rows.name:
An herb with a sweet, fresh, and relaxing
aroma. Even the most lively of creatures
is said to be calmed by the scent.

rows.label: ITM_CLC062_Caption
rows.name:
Although this plant grows throughout the
land, its large seed often sprouts in
narrow crevices, resulting in it becoming
blocked off. It's considered an endangered
species as a result.

rows.label: ITM_CLC063_Caption
rows.name:
A white flower with a modest bloom.
Its height is unremarkable, as is its
appearance. Yet once uprooted,
it shines with an almost divine light.

rows.label: ITM_CLC064_Caption
rows.name:
A short flower which, despite its name,
avoids the sunlight at all costs.
Forcing light upon it, however,
will cause it to grow quite tall.

rows.label: ITM_CLC065_Caption
rows.name:
A plant with a tough, silver-colored flower
that chimes like a bell upon catching the
wind. Its clear tones offer visitors to
Nightglow Forest a brief moment of serenity.

rows.label: ITM_CLC066_Caption
rows.name:
An insectivorous plant that lures prey into
its jaws with a sweet aroma. These fallen
insects become flecks on the plant's body,
eventually mottling each petal.

rows.label: ITM_CLC067_Caption
rows.name:
No amount of plucking will stop this
flower's petals from sprouting right back.
It is said that eating it bestows similar
effects, making it popular with the elderly.

rows.label: ITM_CLC068_Caption
rows.name:
A large cosmos plant whose petals move
in response to stimulus. This has led many
to believe that it may possess a certain
degree of sentience.

rows.label: ITM_CLC069_Caption
rows.name:
A large grass that at first glance looks
like a tree. Contrary to appearances,
however, it is extremely flexible and
surprisingly easy to cut.

rows.label: ITM_CLC070_Caption
rows.name:
With petals that take on the color of their
surroundings, these flowers can be
inordinately difficult to locate.

rows.label: ITM_CLC071_Caption
rows.name:
By allowing its flowers to be eaten by
Miran wildlife, this plant is able to
propagate by dispersing its seed via their
excrement.

rows.label: ITM_CLC072_Caption
rows.name:
Similar to Earth's rocambole plant, but
able to grow at an abnormal daily rate.
This plant is quite short lived, and unable
to proliferate as a result.

rows.label: ITM_CLC073_Caption
rows.name:
This plant contains a unique bitterness
that is coveted among gourmands and
chefs of NLA. Even coffee-type drinks
can be derived from this wonder
ingredient.

rows.label: ITM_CLC074_Caption
rows.name:
An unremarkable grass with emetic
properties that cause those who ingest
it to vomit. It can be used alternatively
as either a medicine or poison.

rows.label: ITM_CLC075_Caption
rows.name:
A cactus with thorns as soft as the
tentacle of a jellyfish. It is said that if
rotting myuena cacti come into contact
with the rain, they turn into silvery
cactaceous resin.

rows.label: ITM_CLC076_Caption
rows.name:
A holly with large purple fruit. These fruits
explode upon impact, dispersing their
stores of pollen. Certain creatures find the
smell of this pollen intolerable.

rows.label: ITM_CLC077_Caption
rows.name:
Glistening leaves sprout from this plant's
long, narrow stem. If blended with saliva,
they produce a viscous liquid that coils
around the throat and restricts breathing.

rows.label: ITM_CLC078_Caption
rows.name:
A flower that emits an explosive sound
when it detects any type of noise nearby.
Stalk it like a ninja unless you want to
be blown to kingdom come.

rows.label: ITM_CLC079_Caption
rows.name:
A plant with a ringed stem that emits a
single soap bubble once a day. These
bubbles carry pollen that gives birth to
the next batch of sese lilies.

rows.label: ITM_CLC080_Caption
rows.name:
A rose with petals that can be used as
dyesâ€”which can then be combined to
form any color on the spectrum. It is said
that these vivid colors will never fade.

rows.label: ITM_CLC081_Caption
rows.name:
A flower that shines with the beauty of 
the finest jewels. As it blooms by stealing
nutrients from other nearby plants, it also
doubles up as a handy weed killer.

rows.label: ITM_CLC082_Caption
rows.name:
A large pollen-filled flower known for its
rapid expansion. The pollen is unusually
appetizing, making it much sought after
by the Nopon.

rows.label: ITM_CLC083_Caption
rows.name:
A golden chrysanthemum that grows and
reproduces by drifting on the winds of
Cauldros, absorbing sulfur as it goes.
Just before death, it takes on the form of
a sulfur crystal.

rows.label: ITM_CLC084_Caption
rows.name:
A hardy plant that refuses to burn even in
the fiery rains of Cauldros. It is, however,
extremely sensitive to cold.

rows.label: ITM_CLC085_Caption
rows.name:
No wildlifeâ€”or speciesâ€”can resist the
charms of this plant. Harvested almost to
extinction by the ancient Mirans, now it
can only be found deep inside Cauldros.

rows.label: ITM_CLC086_Caption
rows.name:
Similar in appearance to a lizardâ€”but
almost completely desiccated due to an
inability to store moisture. As such,
it tends to hunt prey with high water
content.

rows.label: ITM_CLC087_Caption
rows.name:
A small, sleepy, koala-like animal with a
number of wings on its back. These would
be more useful if the animal wasn't so
lazy.

rows.label: ITM_CLC088_Caption
rows.name:
A squirrel-like creature that uses extremely
sharp teeth to carve a home in caves.
If you venture into their lair, you're bound
to come across their fearsome leader.

rows.label: ITM_CLC089_Caption
rows.name:
A giant quadruped bat that uses its
non-functional wings to pull its way
along the ground in search of food.
Vulnerable in the dark, it tends to rest
only in well-lit areas.

rows.label: ITM_CLC090_Caption
rows.name:
A excitable golden fish that is often seen
leaping free of the water. Its taste
resembles that of an Earth sardine.

rows.label: ITM_CLC091_Caption
rows.name:
A three-eared, gunpowder-eating hare.
Sweeping battlefields of every last spent
bullet, their moniker of "The Janitor" is
apt. Their numbers have recently spiked.

rows.label: ITM_CLC092_Caption
rows.name:
A large, snail-like, shelled creature.
The shell contains a store of fatty blubber
that is used for sustenance in times of
severe famine.

rows.label: ITM_CLC093_Caption
rows.name:
A creature that curls into a ball when
attacked, using its rocklike appearance as
camouflage. Burdened by its own weight
as it grows, its final days are reduced to
only the tiniest movements.

rows.label: ITM_CLC094_Caption
rows.name:
A flat fish with a movable eye that allows
it to resemble both a left-eyed and right-
eyed flounder.

rows.label: ITM_CLC095_Caption
rows.name:
This primate's belly pouch is used to
hoard the many treasures which litter the
forest floor. Fiercely protective, only the
foolish would attempt to challenge it.

rows.label: ITM_CLC096_Caption
rows.name:
An iguana-like creature with a long,
extendable tongue that it uses as a fishing
rod. The very best hunters go on to
become boss iguari, dividing their species.

rows.label: ITM_CLC097_Caption
rows.name:
A wild bird with mirrored wings. When
hunted, they use these wings to reflect
the sun's rays, dazzling their pursuers
and granting a brief chance of escape.

rows.label: ITM_CLC098_Caption
rows.name:
A land-roaming jellyfish with a soft,
translucent body. Moving using its many
tentacles, it wraps itself around its prey
before absorbing them into its body.

rows.label: ITM_CLC099_Caption
rows.name:
A small kangaroo-type creature able to
leap many miles in a single jump. Its poor
sense of direction often leads to it 
overshooting its intended target.

rows.label: ITM_CLC100_Caption
rows.name:
A beast with space-distorting camouflage
that allows it to morph into other forms.
Hanging fatty deposits allow it to survive
during lean periods.

rows.label: ITM_CLC101_Caption
rows.name:
The perfect species of mouse. When faced
with adversity, they form into organized
Unions and overpower their opponent
with sheer numbers.

rows.label: ITM_CLC102_Caption
rows.name:
A land-dwelling octopus-like creature with
eight enormously long legs. Its unusually
low body weight makes it highly likely to
fracture in stiff winds.

rows.label: ITM_CLC103_Caption
rows.name:
A turtle-like creature that feeds mainly on
the zizi rabbit. Able to fit its entire body
within its shell, it uses rotation to zip
along at astonishing speeds.

rows.label: ITM_CLC104_Caption
rows.name:
A sea-cucumber-like creature that absorbs
sand into its body for its survival. With 
90 percent of its body weight being sand,
it is able to quickly fill in any wounds.

rows.label: ITM_CLC105_Caption
rows.name:
A small monkey with a featureless face,
it relies on sound and movement to gain
its bearings.

rows.label: ITM_CLC106_Caption
rows.name:
An exceedingly hairy baboon-like creature.
With a lifespan of less than a week,
maturation and aging are both extremely
rapid.

rows.label: ITM_CLC107_Caption
rows.name:
A sheep-like animal with abnormally long,
soft fleece that is ideal for use in clothes.
It's an unusually ill-tempered beast, 
so approach with caution.

rows.label: ITM_CLC108_Caption
rows.name:
A squid-like creature with 20 tentacles
sprouting from its head. Though it often
attacks other creatures, it rarely emerges
victorious.

rows.label: ITM_CLC109_Caption
rows.name:
A small raccoon covered in soft fur that
takes great pleasure in grooming its fellow
creatures. It will even give Dolls a scrub
if given the chance.

rows.label: ITM_CLC110_Caption
rows.name:
A bird covered in mysterious markings.
Intelligent enough to understand language,
it can easily avoid all but the most clever
of predators.

rows.label: ITM_CLC111_Caption
rows.name:
A snake-like reptile that subsists on iron
ore. Its stomach contains mounds of
undigested rocks that are used as bullets
to keep approaching predators at bay.

rows.label: ITM_CLC112_Caption
rows.name:
A five-eyed, boar-like beast. Despite its
demonic appearance, it is surprisingly
timidâ€”often fleeing in terror at the sight
of the smallest insect.

rows.label: ITM_CLC113_Caption
rows.name:
A bird resembling the humble Earth goose,
but with an entrancing angelic call.
This good-natured bird will use its voice
to guide others out of harm's way.

rows.label: ITM_CLC114_Caption
rows.name:
A fox-like creature that draws nutrition
from lava. Any other liquid will result in
instant death, so their numbers tend to
fall considerably after heavy downpours.

rows.label: ITM_CLC115_Caption
rows.name:
A rare species only found in Cauldros.
At first glance it may be mistaken for a
wolfâ€”though its fearsome ruby eyes can
be seen for miles.

rows.label: ITM_CLC116_Caption
rows.name:
What looks like a small rubber ball flying
through the air is in fact a mosquito.
Its countless hair-covered mouths draw 
blood from a whole host of creatures.

rows.label: ITM_CLC117_Caption
rows.name:
A locust that uses its retractable antennae
to gather food. It lacks the jumping ability
of its Earth namesake, instead using its
legs to drag itself around.

rows.label: ITM_CLC118_Caption
rows.name:
A foot-long beetle with horns far tougher
than those of its Earth namesake.
It's usually able to take on any attackers
who dare to challenge it.

rows.label: ITM_CLC119_Caption
rows.name:
An insect that looks like a ladybug.
Its spots increase in number as it ages,
until it becomes fully black in its final
years. It has an odd hatred for music,
and will flee at the first note of a song.

rows.label: ITM_CLC120_Caption
rows.name:
A beetle-like insect that uses meteor shock
waves as sustenance. It is able to
instinctively seek out and locate potential
landing zones prior to any meteorfall.

rows.label: ITM_CLC121_Caption
rows.name:
Solitary ants that wander across Mira
seeking out their next home. Parenthood
is a brief affair, with barely a day's rest
before resuming their journey.

rows.label: ITM_CLC122_Caption
rows.name:
A fist-shaped springtail whose poison
grows in potency with each day. In times
of health their shell appears pink, though
it completely bleaches out upon death.

rows.label: ITM_CLC123_Caption
rows.name:
A luminescent dragonfly from Nightglow Forest.
To attract females, the male radiates in a
spectacular light show that signals the
beginning of courtship.

rows.label: ITM_CLC124_Caption
rows.name:
A light-emitting horsefly. The more blood
it drinks, the brighter and wilder it gets.
Even a single glimpse of its strobe sends
the doragaroos of Valley of Oblivion fleeing.

rows.label: ITM_CLC125_Caption
rows.name:
A moth that makes its own way in life.
However, in amorous times, pairs can be
seen rushing through their courtship dance
as if their lives depended on it.

rows.label: ITM_CLC126_Caption
rows.name:
A hairy insect with a falciform front limb.
With a higher proportion of females
to males, many an epic battle takes place
as females seek to secure a mate.

rows.label: ITM_CLC127_Caption
rows.name:
A hornet with a foot-long stinger that
sends victims into hysteria. Animals stung
by this hornet can often be seen raging
through the forests of Nightglow Forest.

rows.label: ITM_CLC128_Caption
rows.name:
An inconspicuous eight-legged insect that
is actually as heavy as iron. It uses silk
from its eight legs to traverse the treetops
of Nightglow Forest at speed.

rows.label: ITM_CLC129_Caption
rows.name:
This creature attacks tractor beetles on
sight. In all other cases, it uses its large
pincers only for the peaceful cutting of
grass blades.

rows.label: ITM_CLC130_Caption
rows.name:
A butterfly that survives on light emitted
from the sun and fellow Nightglow Forest
residents. In its final throes of life,
it bursts into a spectacular light show.

rows.label: ITM_CLC131_Caption
rows.name:
A gecko-like reptile with a large appetite.
The fatty globule revealed by peeling back
its hard skin is highly prized for a high
protein content and buttery taste.

rows.label: ITM_CLC132_Caption
rows.name:
A worm that draws its nourishment from
miranium, boring ever deeper into the
planet in search of this energy source.
As such, it is rarely seen above ground.

rows.label: ITM_CLC133_Caption
rows.name:
A stink bug that resembles a Nopon from
certain angles. The bug's cry is so
intolerable to the Nopon, however,
that they will do anything to avoid it.

rows.label: ITM_CLC134_Caption
rows.name:
A fly that refracts ambient light,
illuminating its surroundings for miles.
Don't be fooled by its pretty appearanceâ€”
this carnivorous insect is a real handful.

rows.label: ITM_CLC135_Caption
rows.name:
This insect, almost indistinguishable from
branches, chooses not to hide itself in this
way. Instead, it adopts a brownish hue
on green branches, and a green one on
brown branches.

rows.label: ITM_CLC136_Caption
rows.name:
A long, soft-bodied scorpion that uses its
whiplike tail to repel attackers. Constant
use of the tail for various other endeavors
has resulted in evolutionary loss of the
stinger's venom.

rows.label: ITM_CLC137_Caption
rows.name:
The most powerful beetle on the planet.
It tears up foes with razor-sharp horns,
and spits iron-piercing pellets for long-
range strikes. Truly the king of the insects!

rows.label: ITM_CLC138_Caption
rows.name:
A beetle-like creature that feeds on white
sandy spores. It nests in the cliffs of
White Woods, burrowing deep before packing
itself next to its fellow beetles like so
many sardines.

rows.label: ITM_CLC139_Caption
rows.name:
This blue beetle takes to the skies one
month after hatching andâ€”for some
unknown reasonâ€”flies until it reaches the
point of exhaustion.

rows.label: ITM_CLC140_Caption
rows.name:
A cricket with a gossamer-thin shell.
Handle with extreme care, as this fragile
insect will often shatter when caught.

rows.label: ITM_CLC141_Caption
rows.name:
A giant cricket that sleeps in the sand
and rarely ventures above the surface.
Aggressive in its short waking hours,
it will attack on sight.

rows.label: ITM_CLC142_Caption
rows.name:
A splendid butterfly that flies on vivid
violet wings adorned with fine crystal
scales. It's slow to reproduce, but boasts
a lifespan of over 300 years.

rows.label: ITM_CLC143_Caption
rows.name:
A white, furry insect that drifted to
White Woods on the wind. Indistinguishable
from a spore, it is quite difficult to findâ€”
though it is said to bring luck to any
who do so.

rows.label: ITM_CLC144_Caption
rows.name:
After hatching, this larva ages and dies
within the same day. Its rare glow is
beautiful to observe.

rows.label: ITM_CLC145_Caption
rows.name:
A huge red insect that shoots fire from its
mouth, often igniting natural gas spumes
in the process. It is the prime suspect in
many unexplained explosions.

rows.label: ITM_CLC146_Caption
rows.name:
A very large beetle that can reach over
three feet in length. It will imbibe and
expel large volumes of water whenever
threatened.

rows.label: ITM_CLC147_Caption
rows.name:
A tough-bodied and incredibly fast fly.
Getting in their way will likely result in
serious injury, so be careful when
wandering the wilds of Cauldros.

rows.label: ITM_CLC148_Caption
rows.name:
An energetic cricket that is always busy
stockpiling food. It attacks if disturbed,
especially if it comes in contact with its
nemesisâ€”the vagabond ant.

rows.label: ITM_CLC149_Caption
rows.name:
Floating wood that swells up like a
balloon as it absorbs water. Used by
creatures such as the vagabond ant
to travel downstream.

rows.label: ITM_CLC150_Caption
rows.name:
Sand with a high iron concentration.
The process to extract this iron still eludes
NLA scientists, though they are hard
at work on new techniques.

rows.label: ITM_CLC151_Caption
rows.name:
The crystallized excrement of unidentified
microorganisms that has turned
transparent and now resembles a
beautiful crystal.

rows.label: ITM_CLC152_Caption
rows.name:
A hard pearl formed from minerals in
subterranean rivers. It glimmers white in
darkness, but appears transparent when
placed under light.

rows.label: ITM_CLC153_Caption
rows.name:
A diamond-like material that grows like
bamboo on rainy days. It disappears
when exposed to starlight.

rows.label: ITM_CLC154_Caption
rows.name:
A rarely-sighted item seen in polar skies.
Its origin and classification remain a
mystery to everyone.

rows.label: ITM_CLC155_Caption
rows.name:
A leaf that emits faint bursts of radiation.
Found in Nightglow Forest, these leaves can be
used to shed light on other items.

rows.label: ITM_CLC156_Caption
rows.name:
Clay formed from a mixture of gluttonutan
droppings and Nightglow Forest soil. It boasts
unparalleled elasticity, and will not snap
no matter how far it is stretched.

rows.label: ITM_CLC157_Caption
rows.name:
Dirt that contains significant amounts of
sugar. It has a rather gritty aftertaste,
but can be turned into a decent sweetener
with enough processing.

rows.label: ITM_CLC158_Caption
rows.name:
A stone polished into a mirror by the
constant trickle of water from a giant
tree. Staring into it gives the sense
of looking into one's own soul.

rows.label: ITM_CLC159_Caption
rows.name:
An orb that displays future and past
flora and fauna of Mira. Unfortunately,
all that can usually be seen is a
motionless plant or grazing beast.

rows.label: ITM_CLC160_Caption
rows.name:
A cotton plant that grows in the shape
of an arrow. A material of the finest
quality, this cotton is very popular among
the Nopon.

rows.label: ITM_CLC161_Caption
rows.name:
This moss, which grows on the giant trees
of Nightglow Forest, falls and settles like snow.
It is a great insulator, and is often used
by small animals as bedding in winter.

rows.label: ITM_CLC162_Caption
rows.name:
The fossilized remains of plants from
Valley of Oblivion. It has similar properties to coal,
and although it cannot be used as fuel,
it is of use as research material.

rows.label: ITM_CLC163_Caption
rows.name:
A small branch that attracts lightning.
It's likely to have been used as a lightning
rod due to this unique quality.

rows.label: ITM_CLC164_Caption
rows.name:
A sharp-tipped stalactite fragment. 
It emits a beautiful ring of multicolored
light, but careless touching may result in
serious injury.

rows.label: ITM_CLC165_Caption
rows.name:
A claylike, soft silver ore that becomes
hard when forged. Its origin is uncertain,
but it is believed to come from
decomposed myuena cacti.

rows.label: ITM_CLC166_Caption
rows.name:
A mysterious green vapor secreted inside
caves. It turns into oxygen once ventilated,
and for this reason is of great interest to
the scientists of NLA.

rows.label: ITM_CLC167_Caption
rows.name:
This constantly moving mudflow was 
originally thought to be an earthquake,
but in fact, only the surface moves. 
Insects can often be observed hitching a
ride on the top.

rows.label: ITM_CLC168_Caption
rows.name:
Despite being inanimate, these rocks
appear to take root and grow.
As a result, they are often mistaken for
shrubs and trees.

rows.label: ITM_CLC169_Caption
rows.name:
A tree-like, land-based coral. Care is
needed when handling, as the fragile
coral breaks quite easily.

rows.label: ITM_CLC170_Caption
rows.name:
A chemical produced when rainwater
reacts with an unknown airborne
substance. It's harmless for living
organisms, but can dissolve most
inorganic matter.

rows.label: ITM_CLC171_Caption
rows.name:
A rock that registers no value when
placed on a scale. You still wouldn't be
happy if someone chucked it at your
head, however.

rows.label: ITM_CLC172_Caption
rows.name:
Extraordinary heat diffusivity properties
give this substance the ability to maintain
a negative temperature no matter what
environment it is placed in.

rows.label: ITM_CLC173_Caption
rows.name:
A spore that floats through the skies of
White Woods and attracts nearby atmospheric
particles, giving it a gem-like sparkle.

rows.label: ITM_CLC174_Caption
rows.name:
A fragrant form of lava that can be eaten
once cooled. Though completely non-toxic,
it still may be a while before the item
appears on the menus of NLA's finer
restaurants.

rows.label: ITM_CLC175_Caption
rows.name:
A fertile soil that feeds by dissolving
and absorbing insects and certain small
animals. Most geologists believe it to
have fine agricultural potential.

rows.label: ITM_CLC176_Caption
rows.name:
This rock, formed in a lightning storm,
stores lightning energy. It provides an
electrical charge like a battery, but can
be quite unstable.

rows.label: ITM_CLC177_Caption
rows.name:
While this appears to be a powder,
it behaves more like a plant. It can often
be found clinging to rocks, much like a
form of moss.

rows.label: ITM_CLC178_Caption
rows.name:
An organic steel forged in the heat of
Cauldros's lava lakes. It boasts legendary
hardness due to its many layers.

rows.label: ITM_CLC179_Caption
rows.name:
This treasured red oil is found on
Cauldros surfaces during rainy days.
It looks eerily like a pool of blood
to the naked eye.

rows.label: ITM_CLC180_Caption
rows.name:
Originally designed to defend against the
alien onslaught, it failed in its application
when it overheated. It was eventually
recycled as part of the White Whale's
shield system.

rows.label: ITM_CLC181_Caption
rows.name:
A radiator from the White Whale that
requires no coolant. It can be easily
converted for use in cars and other
vehicles.

rows.label: ITM_CLC182_Caption
rows.name:
Plumbing used on the White Whale.
It's made from an experimental form of
stainless steel that is believed to be
eternally rust- and corrosion-proof,
no matter the external environment.

rows.label: ITM_CLC183_Caption
rows.name:
A fuel tank that formed part of the
White Whale's propulsion drive system.
It is said to be the height of fuel-
compression technology.

rows.label: ITM_CLC184_Caption
rows.name:
This instrument analyzes the atmosphere.
It also scans for microbial life, which can
indicate whether or not a planet is
inhabited.

rows.label: ITM_CLC185_Caption
rows.name:
A suit that can withstand the vacuum of
space for over 24 hours. This was
considered to be the height of technology
at the time of the White Whale's launch.

rows.label: ITM_CLC186_Caption
rows.name:
An artificial-gravity generator that
produces a rotating beam. It allows the
crew of a ship to live and work while in
a zero-gravity environment.

rows.label: ITM_CLC187_Caption
rows.name:
A capsule that stored a frozen genetic
database of Earth plant and animal life.
Much of this data was sadly lost in the
crash of the White Whale.

rows.label: ITM_CLC188_Caption
rows.name:
A virtual reality helmet that allows the
user to view scenes from Earth. Imperative
for the morale of any crew on a lengthy
space voyage.

rows.label: ITM_CLC189_Caption
rows.name:
An advanced electronic propulsion system
that allows for precise navigational
control at ultra-high speeds.

rows.label: ITM_CLC190_Caption
rows.name:
A heat-processing device that was finished
just before launch. It recycles heat energy
produced by the engine which would
otherwise have been wasted.

rows.label: ITM_CLC191_Caption
rows.name:
An electronic glove interface which allows
linked devices to be controlled remotely
by the user's hand movements.

rows.label: ITM_CLC192_Caption
rows.name:
This machine can print solid materials
such as basic parts and personal effects.
One was assigned to each mechanic on
the White Whale.

rows.label: ITM_CLC193_Caption
rows.name:
This device projected an energy field
around the White Whale that acted as
a protective shield against space junk.

rows.label: ITM_CLC194_Caption
rows.name:
This photovoltaic system generates power
from solar energy. It was originally
attached to the hull of the White Whale.

rows.label: ITM_CLC195_Caption
rows.name:
This device harvests microbes and organic
space materials, which are then recycled
and converted into energy for the White
Whale.

rows.label: ITM_CLC196_Caption
rows.name:
This mysterious reactor was the White
Whale's primary generator, knowledge of
which was strictly restricted to engineers
directly involved in its operation.

rows.label: ITM_CLC197_Caption
rows.name:
A device that wirelessly transmits energy
particles from one point to another.
This functionality led to great space
savings aboard the White Whale.

rows.label: ITM_CLC198_Caption
rows.name:
A paper-thin protective material.
Its toughness and resistance to heat belies
its thickness.

rows.label: ITM_CLC199_Caption
rows.name:
A uniquely effective device that emits false
DNA signals in order to confuse pursuing
hostile aliens.

rows.label: ITM_CLC200_Caption
rows.name:
A high-energy laser mounted on the White
Whale. It has since been decommissioned,
but the scars of battle still stain its
scorched barrel.

rows.label: ITM_CLC201_Caption
rows.name:
A portion of the AI system installed on
the White Whale. Reliable and sound of
judgment, this essential component of the
flight was unfortunately destroyed during
the crash landing on Mira.

rows.label: ITM_CLC202_Caption
rows.name:
This device captured gas released into
space by stars and converted it into
energy for use in the propulsion system.

rows.label: ITM_CLC203_Caption
rows.name:
A braking mechanism that ran on pure
oxygen. It could also be weaponized for
battle situations if necessary.

rows.label: ITM_CLC204_Caption
rows.name:
A fluorescent paint used on the White
Whale. A high phosphorescence gives it
the ability to emit absorbed light without
a reduction in intensity.

rows.label: ITM_CLC205_Caption
rows.name:
A posture-control apparatus that protects
against spatial disorientation during
interstellar journeys. Primarily used by
crew members undertaking repair details
outside the ship.

rows.label: ITM_CLC206_Caption
rows.name:
A device that extracts water from rocks in
order to aid the process of planetary
terraforming. The discovery of Mira has
rendered it somewhat pointless.

rows.label: ITM_CLC207_Caption
rows.name:
One of the prototype models created
during the development of FrontierNet.
Not as advanced as the data probes
currently in use, but not a bad effort.

rows.label: ITM_CLC208_Caption
rows.name:
A remote-controlled body featuring several
limbs protruding from a spherical center.
It is of particular use for those conducting
sensitive operations in the vacuum of
space.

rows.label: ITM_CLC209_Caption
rows.name:
A mortar lined with tiny spurs that was
used by local natives for making medicine.
One can use the attached pestle to crush
contents with ease.

rows.label: ITM_CLC210_Caption
rows.name:
A counting frame that uses acorns for
beads, leading to speculation that the
native creators had some sort of financial
system.

rows.label: ITM_CLC211_Caption
rows.name:
A living mask made from the bark of a
Miran tree. The bark grows in union with
the face of the wearer, and was thought
holy by ancient peoples for this reason.

rows.label: ITM_CLC212_Caption
rows.name:
A purse used by the ancient inhabitants of
Mira. Listen to the jingle of the coins!
If the previous owner had good luck with
money, maybe a new owner will as well...

rows.label: ITM_CLC213_Caption
rows.name:
A curious stone that emits a mellifluous
hum. When this melody was heard by the
native Mirans, it would inevitably lead to
a raucous dance party.

rows.label: ITM_CLC214_Caption
rows.name:
The Nopon put this stinky ball in their
pocket to repel would-be predators with
its rank odor.

rows.label: ITM_CLC215_Caption
rows.name:
A shellfish plate used by ancient Nopon.
Analysis of the residual material would
surely give an idea of the ancient Nopon
diet, but such investigations are low on
the priority ladder at the moment.

rows.label: ITM_CLC216_Caption
rows.name:
A tub-shaped Nopon boat fashioned from
buoyant driftwood. Historically used by
the Nopon to explore the oceans.

rows.label: ITM_CLC217_Caption
rows.name:
A Nopon lantern stuffed with luminescent
katoan leaves. Harvesting leaves for this
lamp is a labor of love for the many
Nopon who still revere its gentle glow.

rows.label: ITM_CLC218_Caption
rows.name:
A spine-straightening device once very
popular amongst the short-statured Nopon.
It fell out of favor when its effects proved
to be far more damaging than helpful.

rows.label: ITM_CLC219_Caption
rows.name:
A box for storing Nopon pollen-collection
tools that are used to attract insects.
The pollen is eaten and recycled by the
insects before then being harvested.

rows.label: ITM_CLC220_Caption
rows.name:
A spear invented by an ancient species
once they took to walking upright.
Their enlightenment came at a cost,
however, as the same weapon eventually
sealed their demise.

rows.label: ITM_CLC221_Caption
rows.name:
A lithograph etched by an ancient desert
civilization from Valley of Oblivion. As it is currently
indecipherable, the fate met by this culture
is still unknown.

rows.label: ITM_CLC222_Caption
rows.name:
A Nopon dowsing rod for locating mineral
deposits and groundwater. A coin on
one end wobbles when it hits its target.
Hardly the most scientific of methods,
but it seems to work for them.

rows.label: ITM_CLC223_Caption
rows.name:
A dried snake that is eating its own tail.
Used by the Nopon as a bracelet.

rows.label: ITM_CLC224_Caption
rows.name:
A drum made from the stomach of a
beast. It is said to grant bravery to
Nopon embarking on a lonely trek.
If one listens close, they can almost hear
it beating like a courageous heart.

rows.label: ITM_CLC225_Caption
rows.name:
A rectangular stone monument of perfect
black. According to Nopon folklore,
it brings great wisdom to any who dare
touch it.

rows.label: ITM_CLC226_Caption
rows.name:
A plant-based ointment used by the
Nopon. It fell out of favor when its
medicinal effects were found to be
negligible.

rows.label: ITM_CLC227_Caption
rows.name:
A flotation device made from straw.
Though it starts out as a huge straw ring,
it rapidly shrinks to a more compact size
when it contacts water.

rows.label: ITM_CLC228_Caption
rows.name:
A spore repainted by the Nopon and
sold as a child's balloon toy. Its value
tanked when the true identity was finally
discovered.

rows.label: ITM_CLC229_Caption
rows.name:
A long cylinder with carefully aligned
stone lenses, often used as a telescope to
view the stars. Unusually expensive for
something that brings so much joy.

rows.label: ITM_CLC230_Caption
rows.name:
The cloth used to make this cloak imitates
its surroundings. It looks to have been
invented by an advanced civilization that
has since gone extinct.

rows.label: ITM_CLC231_Caption
rows.name:
A branch adorned with hundreds of
beautiful Miran flowers. It is used by the
Nopon for spiritual worship.

rows.label: ITM_CLC232_Caption
rows.name:
A Nopon-sized trampoline made from a
an elastic, rubberish material. Once used
at festival time, it has since been banned
after a slew of injuries and lawsuits.

rows.label: ITM_CLC233_Caption
rows.name:
A hard stone carved into the shape of a
hammer and used in construction.
For some reason, the whole tool is carved
from stoneâ€”not just the head.

rows.label: ITM_CLC234_Caption
rows.name:
A giant black vessel fashioned from lava.
Said to have been constructed by a now-
extinct civilization.

rows.label: ITM_CLC235_Caption
rows.name:
A polished, transparent stone often used
as a lens. Nopon also value it for its
ability to start fires.

rows.label: ITM_CLC236_Caption
rows.name:
A hand lamp that uses a secret Nopon
oil formula to emit a beautiful light.
Due to difficulties in producing the oil,
such lanterns rarely shine anymore.

rows.label: ITM_CLC237_Caption
rows.name:
An invention of Nopon who dreamed of
taking to the skies. Shockingly ineffective,
though that doesn't deter the many Nopon
who optimistically plummet to their deaths
each year.

rows.label: ITM_CLC238_Caption
rows.name:
A fire-resistant, 20-foot-long sleeping bag
woven from bogano weed. Originally
made by giants, but now used as a yurt
by grateful Nopon.

rows.label: ITM_CLC239_Caption
rows.name:
A piggy bank used by ancient Nopon.
Legend claims that those who broke it
open before it was full would have money
trouble for the rest of their days.

rows.label: ITM_CLC240_Caption
rows.name:
A small alien jetpack that allows the
user to flee from confrontation at absurd
speeds.

rows.label: ITM_CLC241_Caption
rows.name:
A cruel alien torture device that coils
around the head, arms, and legs, severely
constricting the victim.

rows.label: ITM_CLC242_Caption
rows.name:
A prototype high-tech device that allows
the user to see through walls. It seems
like true cutting-edge technology,
but is unfortunately broken.

rows.label: ITM_CLC243_Caption
rows.name:
A mottled flask seemingly used to safely
store precious liquid. Its seal has long
since been broken, making its former
contents a mystery for the ages.

rows.label: ITM_CLC244_Caption
rows.name:
An orb that emits a rather sinister glow.
It possesses vast amounts of energy,
but is harmful to humans.

rows.label: ITM_CLC245_Caption
rows.name:
An alien device that interfaces directly
with the brain. Not usable by humans.

rows.label: ITM_CLC246_Caption
rows.name:
A honeycomb-shaped body-scanning
device used by insectoid aliens.

rows.label: ITM_CLC247_Caption
rows.name:
An entirely sterile tank completely devoid
of any organisms or bacteria.
How very dull.

rows.label: ITM_CLC248_Caption
rows.name:
An electromagnetic device used by
shape-shifting aliens. It interferes with the
sensory perception of other individuals in
the area.

rows.label: ITM_CLC249_Caption
rows.name:
A high-performance filtration machine
that can create water from soil and sand.
When the start button is pressed, a voice
calls out, â€œWater-making time, right?â€
and music begins playing.

rows.label: ITM_CLC250_Caption
rows.name:
Goggles designed by giant aliens that
transmit information and orders directly
into the eye of the user.

rows.label: ITM_CLC251_Caption
rows.name:
A furnace that faces the skies in prayer,
probably used for religious rites and
festivals. It contains what appears to be
the remains of multiple sacrifices.

rows.label: ITM_CLC252_Caption
rows.name:
An alien tail protector emblazoned with a
clan crest. The quality of workmanship
indicates that it once belonged to an
individual of some status.

rows.label: ITM_CLC253_Caption
rows.name:
A large, primitive helmet made from a
resilient-looking shell. Its two protruding
horns inspire terror in battle.

rows.label: ITM_CLC254_Caption
rows.name:
A knuckle guard made from the skull of a
fallen opponent. Its battle-worn look is
accentuated by numerous scratches and
dents that tell an epic story.

rows.label: ITM_CLC255_Caption
rows.name:
A high-tech lava suit made from unknown
materials. Unfortunately, as it operates on
biometrics it will destroy itself if worn by
any species other than its original creator.

rows.label: ITM_CLC256_Caption
rows.name:
An excessively large hoop-shaped device
that equips to the arm. The alien tech and
size of the device mean that it is not
easily handled by human operators.

rows.label: ITM_CLC257_Caption
rows.name:
Wiring composed of countless fiber cables.
Using this wire allowed for free control of
launched missiles.

rows.label: ITM_CLC258_Caption
rows.name:
An item used to induce a rage-like state
in battle. If given to one not able to
tolerate the medication's effects,
however, instant death is a certainty.

rows.label: ITM_CLC259_Caption
rows.name:
A banner emblazoned with the crest of a
militaristic alien clan. Its content boasts
of that particular group's achievements on
the battlefield.

rows.label: ITM_CLC260_Caption
rows.name:
A tight-fitting crown that can only be
removed by breaking it. Thought to have
been used in torture.

rows.label: ITM_CLC261_Caption
rows.name:
There is said to be a large body of high-
level info embedded within this liquid
metal. Unfortunately, the liquid is currently
inert and remains just out of reach.

rows.label: ITM_CLC262_Caption
rows.name:
An item able to view and detect the entire
range of electromagnetic waves, including
infrared. It is also able to stand in for
microscopes and telescopes.

rows.label: ITM_CLC263_Caption
rows.name:
Specialized alien battle claws that appear
to be used more as catalysts for energy-
based attacks rather than for actual
hand-to-hand fighting.

rows.label: ITM_CLC264_Caption
rows.name:
This device transforms airborne particles
into electrical power, ensuring an almost
inexhaustible supply of energy. It seems to
have been used as a weapon by certain
alien races.

rows.label: ITM_CLC265_Caption
rows.name:
A deceptively strong, yet compact, part
for jointing and supporting large objects
above the ground. Is currently used as a
gravitational-control device.

rows.label: ITM_CLC266_Caption
rows.name:
Blade fragments from an alien Doll.
Its materials exhibit properties of both
great strength and extreme lightness.
It also appears to contain a slight
electrical charge.

rows.label: ITM_CLC267_Caption
rows.name:
The panels on this item contain lamps that
inform of any nearby toxins. As it
requires alien-based technology to
function, it doesn't seem to be usable by
humans.

rows.label: ITM_CLC268_Caption
rows.name:
A chemical powder made of an unknown
element. When the Avalancher Boze Rose gave it a
sniff, he felt it improved his concentration,
and thus decided to give it this name.

rows.label: ITM_CLC269_Caption
rows.name:
A spherical crystal that shimmers with the
baked orange glow of a California dusk.
The Pathfinder Corondas named it in memory
of the sunsets he saw as a child back in
his home state.

rows.label: ITM_CLC270_Caption
rows.name:
The image presented to those who peer
into this eyepiece is rarely consistent with
reality. In fact, some of the views have
been truly out-of-this world, which is why
the Arms Camber gave it this name.

rows.label: ITM_CLC271_Caption
rows.name:
Covered in jumbled and indecipherable
lettering, these cylindrical objects have
been found scattered across Mira.
The Pathfinder Clarissa gave them this
name while struggling to decode them.

rows.label: ITM_CLC272_Caption
rows.name:
A carved stone shaped in the image of a
beautiful goddess. On occasion, a tear-
like liquid flows from its eyes. Entranced
by the object's beauty, the Arms
Christopher came up with its name.

rows.label: ITM_CLC273_Caption
rows.name:
Named by the Collepedian Jengo, this
mysterious object contains a multitude
of magnetic stones that orbit erratically
within its cube-like frame.

rows.label: ITM_CLC274_Caption
rows.name:
A compact radar that flashes with multiple
points of interest, though nothing is ever
found at the indicated spots. The Companion
Lara Nara named the device while putting
on his makeup.

rows.label: ITM_CLC275_Caption
rows.name:
When objects are placed upon the scales,
they tip not from the actual weight,
but from some other form of mass.
The Companion Justin declared this as
"measuring the weight of justice."

rows.label: ITM_CLC276_Caption
rows.name:
The space enclosed within this transparent
box supports a floating spherical object,
the constant rotation of which produces a
never-ending supply of kinetic energy.
Named rather plainly by the Collepedian Mei.

rows.label: ITM_CLC277_Caption
rows.name:
A pair of gigantic stone idols locked in
combat. No one is sure who sculpted them
or gave them their name, but their primal
beauty often leaves a deep impression on
those who stand before them.

rows.label: ITM_CLC278_Caption
rows.name:
A rust-ravaged iron column with a tensile
strength that defies reason. Despite being
rusted to the core, it can easily withstand
loads many times that of standard iron.
Named by the Collepedian Howard.

rows.label: ITM_CLC279_Caption
rows.name:
Sand that is able to change its colorâ€”
and with that, its taste. Ranging from
salty when white to sweet when red,
the possible variations are endless.
Named by the Landbanker Sarona.

rows.label: ITM_CLC280_Caption
rows.name:
A jewel that sparkles like the first star of
the evening. The Testamenter Nastasha
began wearing one as a charm to protect
her companions, and the idea caught on
with other BLADEs, leading to its name.

rows.label: ITM_CLC281_Caption
rows.name:
An obnoxious rock that throws your words
right back at you. Good luck confronting
it, though, since it is dull and featureless
as...well, a stone. The Collepedian Jengo
named it with a smile.

rows.label: ITM_CLC282_Caption
rows.name:
A lithograph that appears to hold encoded
blueprints for a Doll-like robotic machine.
The engineer Tika named it in frustration
after staying up all night failing to
decipher its instructions.

rows.label: ITM_CLC283_Caption
rows.name:
A transparent stone that holds a
fossilized, angelic-looking creature.
Transfixed by its heavenly beauty,
the Avalancher Adelbert gave it its name.

rows.label: ITM_CLC284_Caption
rows.name:
A machine to fuse crystals that conceal
some sort of energy. The problem is,
said crystals don't seem to exist. Upon
realizing its uselessness, the Avalancher
Ariel Sera named it in disappointment.

rows.label: ITM_CLC285_Caption
rows.name:
A mysterious white object with a double
helical structure. The Collepedian Caracas
discovered and named it, but died of
poisoning after tasting it.

rows.label: ITM_CLC286_Caption
rows.name:
The liquid within this tube emits a brilliant
green glow, but the unknown energy it
produces is of no use in current weapons.
The Landbanker Libro Cole named it
while laughing heartily.

rows.label: ITM_CLC287_Caption
rows.name:
An egg-shaped object that plays host to
a variety of different flower species. Upon
witnessing said flowers breaking out from
the egg's shell to bloom, a speechless
Landbanker called Gale gave it this name.

rows.label: ITM_CLC288_Caption
rows.name:
A snowy white, angelic feather that
shimmers with an air of refined nobility.
The Avalancher Grette gave the item its name
as she gazed at it, enraptured.

rows.label: ITM_CLC289_Caption
rows.name:
A screw made of stone thatâ€”despite being
entirely natural in originâ€”can actually be
used as in the way the name suggests.
After naming it, the Pathfinder Astea did
in fact put it to use as a screw.

rows.label: ITM_CLC290_Caption
rows.name:
A black-box planetarium that projects an
image of the galaxy Mira inhabits onto
nearby surfaces. The Pathfinder Mondo
named it as he gazed in abject silence
at the projected stars.

rows.label: ITM_CLC291_Caption
rows.name:
This looks like some kind of transmitting
device, but no one knows where it is
transmitting to. The Interceptor Ada
named it after mumbling â€œhello, helloâ€
into it numerous times with no response.

rows.label: ITM_CLC292_Caption
rows.name:
A chain of unbreakable triangular rings
that are impossible to separate.
Upon witnessing its unwavering strength,
the Collepedian Quincy gave it this name to
symbolize the bonds between friends.

rows.label: ITM_CLC293_Caption
rows.name:
A shock-absorbing component that seems
to have been used in ancient automatons.
The Interceptor Giotto used it as exercise
equipment and gave it a name to suit his
personal tastes.

rows.label: ITM_CLC294_Caption
rows.name:
A cylindrical rod with a complex dimpled
surface. While it somewhat resembles a
key, the Murderessâ€™s first thought was how
she could use it to pummel people. Suffice
to say, she came up with the name.

rows.label: ITM_CLC295_Caption
rows.name:
A cauldron that billows with thick black
smoke and is engraved from top to bottom
with strange symbols. After discovering it,
the Landbanker Harvey gave it a fanciful
name in hopes of selling it for big money.

rows.label: ITM_CLC296_Caption
rows.name:
Though it looks like a baby's trinket, the
noise this rattle produces when shaken has
the power to fell buildings. A Landbanker
named Ginger gave it its name, and it is
currently being researched as a weapon.

rows.label: ITM_CLC297_Caption
rows.name:
An ornately decorated scepter,
speculated to have once been utilized as
a ceremonial piece for ancient nobility.
Pathfinder H.B. thought it a perfect fit
for himself and gave it this name.

rows.label: ITM_CLC298_Caption
rows.name:
Seemingly both mechanical and organic,
this mask-shaped object has the ability to
absorb bodily fluids. The Arms Axena
gave it its name in a fit of excitement.

rows.label: ITM_CLC299_Caption
rows.name:
A tablet depicting a scene of terror
involving people fleeing from a dragon-
like beast. Excited by this unknown
creature that may or may not even exist,
Landbanker Vera came up with this name.

rows.label: ITM_CLC300_Caption
rows.name:
This book is worn to nigh unreadability,
but the illustrations of giants depicted
within feel somehow nostalgic. Letrick,
the cathedral overseer, broke into tears
upon seeing it and gave it this name.
